turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hey there, I'm trying to find a new game to play. Could you recommend some good open-world RPGs?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Certainly! Open-world RPGs are a great choice for immersive experiences. Some highly-regarded titles in this genre include The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt, Elden Ring, The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim, and Red Dead Redemption 2. Do any of those sound appealing?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Yeah, I've played Witcher 3 and Skyrim to death, and Elden Ring feels a bit too hardcore soulslike for me right now. Red Dead is great but I was thinking more fantasy? Like, magic and dragons and stuff. It feels like everything is either super dark fantasy soulslike or sci-fi these days, which is kinda frustrating when you just want some classic fantasy adventure.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Ah, I see. You're looking for fantasy-specific open-world RPGs, distinct from soulslike. Besides Skyrim, there's Dragon Age: Inquisition. It has a large world and fantasy elements. Also, Kingdoms of Amalur: Re-Reckoning offers a vast fantasy world to explore. Fable III is another older option with a fantasy setting.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hmm, Dragon Age: Inquisition is a good suggestion, I've heard of that one. Kingdoms of Amalur... not sure I've heard of that, but I'll check it out. Fable III is probably too old for what I'm looking for graphically, honestly. Thanks for trying though, Inquisition seems promising!
